item.title: My 2021 in Writing
item.description:
This is going to be a different one, and open to non-subscribers. I like to take the end of the year to reflect on my various projects, usually on my personal blog. This year, I thought I would look back on my writing here at The End of Safety. I beg your indulgence for putting this in your inboxes, if you‚Äôre a subscriber‚Ä¶

URL: https://endofsafety.substack.com/p/my-2021-in-writing?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In Which I Plump for √æe Humanities‚Ä¶

item.title: No Solutions
item.description:
It does not take much for technologists to become technocrats. When you work chiefly in a domain which has expanded humanity‚Äôs capabilities in a palpably measurable way in your lifetime, it becomes very easy to think nearly all of life‚Äôs problems can be solved by adopting a similar stance‚Ä¶

URL: https://endofsafety.substack.com/p/no-solutions?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In Which I Plump for √æe Humanities‚Ä¶

item.description:

Or why mainstream journalists have a such hard time not pulling punches when it comes to characterizing Fox News as what it really is ‚Äî a propaganda machine? If these questions pique your interest, this is the newsletter for you‚Ä¶

item.title: False Dichotomy in the Fascism Debate
item.description:
Is Donald Trump a fascist? The debate, which started in 2015 and shows no sign of slowing down, has gone on so long that it has ceased to be a dialogue and has devolved into competing monologues, with both sides reiterating their stated positions with no hope of concession or conver‚Ä¶

URL: https://jeetheer.substack.com/p/false-dichotomy-in-the-fascism-debate?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In Which I Plump for √æe Humanities‚Ä¶

item.title: The omicron paradox.
item.description:
If you were to chart, by country, the number of confirmed COVID deaths per million on one axis and GDP per capita on the other (below), there is no other country with as high a GDP with as many deaths; America has, pound for pound, fared worse throughout this pandemic than any other country on Earth. This is particularly astounding considering the wealth of our country, the fact that most of the world‚Äôs public health infrastructure was modeled off of ours, and that we spend nearly a fifth of our entire economy on healthcare‚Ä¶

URL: https://abdulelsayed.substack.com/p/the-omicron-paradox?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In Which I Plump for √æe Humanities‚Ä¶

item.title: How are the post-Soviet economies doing?
item.description:
Today (well, yesterday, by the time you‚Äôre reading this) is the 30th anniversary of the fall of the Soviet Union, one of the most momentous geopolitical events of my lifetime. The main reason this was important wasn‚Äôt economic ‚Äî it was proof that the fall of a superpower didn‚Äôt mean nuclear holocaust. And it meant the end of the Cold War, which brought ‚Ä¶

URL: https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/how-are-the-post-soviet-economies?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: The Destinies of the Former Soviet Empire

item.title: The Racist Underbelly of MAGA Restrictionists
item.description:
The last meaningful reform of our immigration laws was enacted nearly four decades ago, yet virtually everyone‚Äîimmigration advocates and foes alike‚Äîagree that our laws no longer serve the needs of the nation. Why is it, then, that we‚Äôve been unable to change outdated laws, or even ensure an orderly flow on our borders? Many have pointed to Americans‚Äô ec‚Ä¶

URL: https://theunpopulist.substack.com/p/the-racist-underbelly-of-maga-restrictionists?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: The Destinies of the Former Soviet Empire

item.title: What makes an "optimistic" vision of the future?
item.description:
‚ÄúThere will be no war and there will be no greed and all of the children will know how to read.‚Äù ‚Äî Gene Roddenberry The Expanse just finished airing on Amazon, so I thought I‚Äôd write another post about sci-fi! I thought the final season was solid and the ending was good, but it felt rushed, as if substantial parts of the last season had been edited out. But simply ending well is something very few shows manage to do, so I count this as a win; The Expanse wins a place in my list of favorite sci-fi TV series of all time (a list I will get around to writing up at some point‚Ä¶

URL: https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/what-makes-an-optimistic-vision-of?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
